title: Analyze particle motion, given velocity part - c

content.description: A particle moves along the x-axis so that its velocity at time t ,0 ≤ t ≤ 5 , is given by v(t) = 3(t−1)(t−3) . At time t =2 , the position of the particle is x(2)=0 .
content.question: Find the average velocity of the particle over the interval 0 ≤ t ≤ 5

frqParts.text: Find the average velocity of the particle over the interval 0 ≤ t ≤ 5

topic.text: 8.1: Finding the Average Value of a Function on an Interval

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
